title: Can a teenager write novels? - Quora

response.answer_text: YES, definitely. Words have no age boundaries. Being a writer depends on how to play with the words, how you create beautiful sentences out of them. No one reads a book on the basis of a writer’s age or his name or his appearance. All what matters is how much the you can make the reader connect with the feeling you felt while writing down those words. So, if you think you can, then you must try and go for it. THANK YOU.

Of course a teenager can write books. I’m 13 and I’m writing a book. Even if nobody wants to publish it keep writing if it makes you happy. I even sent my book to a publisher. No joy though 😂. I kept writing though and I sent it to another publisher and they replied. So keep writing your book you never know what might happen.
Yes. See Ben Brooks early work written when he was a teenager. Accept that it is unlikely you will appeal to older readers but maybe you don't want to. Just write, forget age etc etc
